intro: Scabiosa olivieri, commonly known as the Sicilian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Scabiosa olivieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to attract pollinators.
